Tunable.name: accept_looking_for_more_work
Tunable.description:
If checked will allow instanced Sims to be assigned this job if those Sims have declared themselves to be looking for new work. This will overrule any exclusivity rules in place.
NOTE: YOU PROBABLY WANT TO LEAVE THIS AS UNCHECKED. PLEASE CONSULT A GPE IF YOU PLAN ON TUNING IT.

Tunable.name: additional_filter_for_user_selection
Tunable.description:
An additional filter that will run for the situation job if there should be specific additional requirements for selecting specific sims for the role rather than hiring them.
Will be or'd with any filters in additional filter list for user selection

TunableList.name: additional_filter_list_for_user_selection
TunableList.display: Additional Filter List For User Selection
TunableList.description:
List of additional filters that will run for the situation job if there should be specific additional requirements for selecting specific sims for the role rather than hiring them. Sims only need to pass one of the filters.
Will be or'd with any filter in additional filter for user selection

Tunable.description: An additional filter that will run for the situation job if there should be specific additional requirements for selecting specific sims for the role rather than hiring them.

Tunable.name: apply_weather_based_uniform
Tunable.description: If set (default), will apply weather based uniform. Only applied if no job_uniform tuned.

TunableList.name: blacklist_info
TunableList.description: Allows a sim to be blacklisted from being available for future jobs for the specified duration and job type(s).

TunableEnum.name: blacklist_tag
TunableEnum.description: When a Sim is removed from a situation, they are added to the blacklist with this tag. This allows a sim to be blacklisted for some job types, but not others.

Tunable.name: blacklist_time
Tunable.description: When a Sim is removed from a situation, they are added to the blacklist for this time duration in hours.

Tunable.name: can_be_hired
Tunable.description: This job can be hired.

TunableVariant.name: churn
TunableVariant.description:
!!!DEPRECATED!!! Please use zone director functionality to provide the same results.
If enabled, produces churn or turnover in the sims holding this job. Periodically sims in the job will leave the lot and other sims will come to fill the job.
When a situation is first started it will automatically invite a number of sims appropriate for the time of day. This supercedes sim_auto_invite.
This is primarily for commercial venue customers. This is NOT compatible with Sim Shifts.

TunableList.name: auto_populate_by_time_of_day
TunableList.display: Auto Populate By Time Of Day
TunableList.description:
Each entry in the map has two columns. The first column is the hour of the day (0-24) that this entry begins to control the number of sims in the job. The second column is the minimum and maximum desired number of sims. The entry with starting hour that is closest to, but before the current hour will be chosen.
Given this tuning: beginning_hour desired_population 6 1-3 10 3-5 14 5-7 20 7-9
if the hour is 11, beginning_hour will be 10 and desired is 3-5. if the hour is 19, beginning_hour will be 14 and desired is 5-7. if the hour is 23, beginning_hour will be 20 and desired is 7-9. if the hour is 2, beginning_hour will be 20 and desired is 7-9. (uses 20 tuning because it is not 6 yet)
The entries will be automatically sorted by time on load, so you don't have to put them in order (but that would be nutty)

TunableTuple.name: desired_population
TunableTuple.description: A tunable interval between lower_bound and upper_bound.

Tunable.name: lower_bound
Tunable.description: The lower bound of the interval.

Tunable.name: upper_bound
Tunable.description: The upper bound of the interval.

Tunable.name: chance_to_add_or_remove_sim
Tunable.display: Chance To Add Or Remove Sim
Tunable.description:
Periodically the churn system will re-evaluate the number of sims currently in the job. If the number of sims is above or below the range it will add/remove one sim as appropriate. If the number of sims is within the tuned range it will roll the dice to determine what it should do: nothing add a sim remove a sim
The chance tuned here (1-100) is the chance that it will do something (add/remove), as opposed to nothing.
When it is going to do something, the determination of whether to add or remove is roughly 50/50 with additional checks to stay within the range of desired sims and respect the min duration.

Tunable.name: min_duration
Tunable.description: Minimum amount of time a sim in this job will stay before they might be churned out.

TunableList.name: commodities
TunableList.description:
Update the commodities on the sim that is assigned this job. These are applied only on NPC sims since the tuning is forcing changes to statistics that have player facing effects.
E.g. The students arrive at the lecture hall with the bored and sleepy commodities.

TunableVariant.name: text
TunableVariant.description:
Specify the display text to use for this tunable. This tuning structure may be shared across multiple tunables. It is up to the system consuming the tunable to determine in which ways the tuned display text is used.
e.g. Loot Operations The adventure system auto-generates notifications based on the loot that was awarded from a chance card. A loot's display text, if used, will be an item in the generated bulleted list. The ability to override display text allows tuners to set custom next in such notifications.
e.g. Reward Tuning Rewards have display text so that, similarly to adventures, a bulleted list of entries can be auto-generated when obtained by a Sim. Use this tunable to control the text of such entries.

e.g. Loot Operations The adventure system auto-generates notifications based on the loot that was awarded from a chance card. A loot's display text, if used, will be an item in the generated bulleted list. The ability to override display text allows tuners to set custom next in such notifications.
e.g. Reward Tuning Rewards have display text so that, similarly to adventures, a bulleted list of entries can be auto-generated when obtained by a Sim. Use this tunable to control the text of such entries.

Tunable.name: exclusive_to_owning_si
Tunable.description: If enabled, this gain will be exclusive to the SI that created it and will not be allowed to occur if the sim is running mixers from a different SI. If disabled, this gain will happen as long as this SI is active, regardless of which SI owns the mixer the sim is currently running. This is only effective on Sims.

TunableVariant.name: maximum
TunableVariant.description: A variant containing the different ways you can cap the max amount a statistic reaches as result of a change.

TunableTuple.name: points
TunableTuple.description: The max amount of points that a stat can achieve after an increase.

Tunable.name: max_points
Tunable.description: The point total that a stat cannot go above when increasing. If the increase would go above this point total, instead it will just be equal to this point total.

TunableTuple.name: rank
TunableTuple.description: The max rank a stat can achieve after an increase.

Tunable.name: max_rank
Tunable.description:
The rank that a stat cannot go beyond when increasing. If the increase would go beyond achieving this rank, instead it will be set to the min points required to meet this rank. This will prevent any gains toward the next rank from occurring.
NOTE: Must be used with a RankedStatistic or it will return 0 as the max.

TunableVariant.name: object_cost_multiplier
TunableVariant.description: When enabled allows you to multiply the stat gain amount based on the value of the object specified.

TunableTuple.description: A construct that determines a multiplier based on the value/cost of an object.

TunableList.name: multiplier_curve
TunableList.description: The multiplier will be determined by interpolating against a curve. The value of the subject in simoleons is used. This means that a curve for cost should have value at its x-axis.

TunableTuple.description: Point on a Curve

Tunable.name: x
Tunable.description: x component

Tunable.name: y
Tunable.description: y component

TunableEnum.name: subject
TunableEnum.description: The object whose cost you want to base the multiplier on.

TunableEnum.name: periodic_change_behavior
TunableEnum.description:
When applying this change operation at the beginning of an interaction as part of a periodic statistic change and statistic is a continuous statistic, tune the behavior of this operation when interaction begins.
Terminology: BaseBehavior: For change operations that succeed chance and test or if chance is 100% or no tests, the statistic stores the start time and when interaction ends determine how much time is passed and multiply amount. Continuous statistic WILL NOT decay with this behavior. This is for better performance.
IntervalBehavior: If continuous statistic is using interval behavior. the amount tuned will be given at specified interval if chance and tests succeeds. Continuous statistics WILL decay between interval time.
Tuning Behavior APPLY_AT_START_ONLY: If chance and tests for change operation is successful, periodic update will occur and follow BaseBehavior. If either fail, change operation is not given at any point.
RETEST_ON_INTERVAL: If test and chance succeeds, then this will follow BaseBehavior. If test or chance fails, this operation will follow interval behavior.
APPLY_AT_INTERVAL_ONLY: This will strictly follow Interval Behavior.

TunableList.name: statistic_multipliers

amount *= statistic.value

TunableList.name: value_curve
TunableList.description: The multiplier will be determined by interpolating against a curve. The user-value is used. This means that a curve for skills should have levels as its x-axis.

TunableTuple.description: Attempt to remove the specified statistic.

Tunable.name: stat
Tunable.description: The statistic we are operating on.

TunableVariant.name: text
TunableVariant.description:
Specify the display text to use for this tunable. This tuning structure may be shared across multiple tunables. It is up to the system consuming the tunable to determine in which ways the tuned display text is used.
e.g. Loot Operations The adventure system auto-generates notifications based on the loot that was awarded from a chance card. A loot's display text, if used, will be an item in the generated bulleted list. The ability to override display text allows tuners to set custom next in such notifications.
e.g. Reward Tuning Rewards have display text so that, similarly to adventures, a bulleted list of entries can be auto-generated when obtained by a Sim. Use this tunable to control the text of such entries.

Tunable.name: override
Tunable.description: Specify a string override. The tokens are different depending on the type of tunable.

TdescFragTag.name: tests

TunableEnum.name: transfer_type
TunableEnum.description: Type of statistic transfer to use.

TunableVariant.name: transfer_type_average_advanced
TunableVariant.description:
If enabled, the average calculation will be the sum of multiplying the stat value and stat quantity then dividing with total quantity. T = Transferred Stat value S = Stat value QT = Quantity Transferred Stat value QS = Quantity Stat value Result = ((T * QT) + (S * QS)) / (QT + QS)
If disabled, the result will calculate Mean of 2 stat values. Result = (T + S) / 2

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Statistic quantities for both subject and donor.

Tunable.name: quantity_stat
Tunable.description: Statistic quantity subject which will be applied to the average calculation.

Tunable.name: quantity_transferred_stat
Tunable.description: Statistic quantity donor which will be applied to the average calculation.

Tunable.name: transferred_stat
Tunable.description: The statistic whose value to transfer.

Tunable.name: confirm_leave_situation_for_work
Tunable.description:
Sims in situations who go to work will automatically be pulled out of the situation. If this is enabled, a dialog will show for playable Sims, asking player to confirm going to work, decline going, or take PTO (if Sim has any).
Dialog that shows up is tunable at: careers.career_tuning -> Career -> Leave_Event_Confirmation

Tunable.description: Skills needed to pass amount on.

Tunable.name: score
Tunable.description: Score for passing the test.

TunableEnum.name: died_or_left_action
TunableEnum.description:
The action to take if a sim in this job dies or leaves the lot.
Examples: If the bartender leaves the ambient bar situation, you need a new one (REPLACE_THEM) If your creepy uncle leaves the wedding, you don't care (DO_NOTHING) If your maid dies cleaning the iron maiden, you are out of luck for today (END_SITUATION).
NB: Do not use REPLACE_THEM if you are using Sim Churn for this job.

Tunable.name: display_name
Tunable.description:
Localized name of this job. This name is displayed in the situation creation UI where the player is making selection of sims that belong to a specific job. E.g. "Guest", "Bride or Groom", "Bartender".
Whenever you add a display name, evaluate whether your design needs or calls out for a tooltip_name.

Tunable.name: elevated_importance
Tunable.description:
If True, then filling this job with a Sim will be done before filling similar jobs in this situation. This will matter when starting a situation on another lot, when inviting a large number of Sims, visiting commercial venues, or when at the cap on NPCs.
Examples: Wedding Situation: the Bethrothed Sims should be spawned before any guests. Birthday Party: the Sims whose birthday it is should be spawned first. Bar Venue: the Bartender should be spawned before the barflies.

TunableList.name: emotional_setup
TunableList.description:
Apply the WeightedSingleSimLootActions on the sim that is assigned this job. These are applied only on NPC sims since the tuning is forcing changes to emotions.
E.g. an angry mob at the bar, flirty guests at a wedding party.

Tunable.name: weight
Tunable.description: Accompanying weight of the loot.

Tunable.name: game_breaker
Tunable.description: If True then this job must be filled by a sim or the game will be broken. This is for the grim reaper and the social worker.

Tunable.name: give_rewards_to_npc
Tunable.description: If true we will give this reward to NPCs instead of only to selectable sims.

Tunable.name: goal_scoring
Tunable.description: The score for completing a goal

TunableVariant.name: goodbye_notification
TunableVariant.description: The "goodbye" notification that will be set on Sims with this situation job. This notification will be displayed when the Sim leaves the lot (unless it gets overridden later). Examples: the visitor job sets the "goodbye" notification to something so the player knows when visitors leave; the party guest roles use "No Notification", because we don't want 20-odd notifications when a party ends; the leave lot jobs use "Use Previous Notification" because we want leaving Sims to display whatever notification was set earlier.

Tunable.name: never_use_notification_no_matter_what
Tunable.display: Never Use Notification No Matter What

TunableVariant.name: notification
TunableVariant.description: This may be tuned in place here using 'literal' or as a reference to a Notification tuning snippet.

Tunable.name: immediate_audio
Tunable.description:
If checked, this audio will be triggered immediately, nothing will block.
ex. Earbuds audio will be played immediately while the Sim is routing or animating.

TunableVariant.name: joint_name_hash
TunableVariant.description: Specify if the audio is attached to a slot and, if so, which slot. Otherwise the audio will be attached to the object's origin.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The name of the slot this audio is attached to.

Tunable.name: play_on_active_sim_only
Tunable.description:
If enabled, and audio target is Sim, the audio will only be played on selected Sim. Otherwise it will be played regardless Sim is selected or not.
If audio target is Object, always set this to False. Otherwise the audio will never be played.
ex. This will be useful for Earbuds where we want to hear the music only when the Sim is selected.

Tunable.name: ignore_on_creation_restrictions
Tunable.description:
The On Creation tunables (Emotional Setup and Commodities) will only be applied if the Sim is in no other Situations and is actively being created for this Situation/Job. In some cases, like Diners at Restaurants, we want to ignore these restrictions so Commodity and Emotional changes are made when this Situation Job is applied.
NOTE: On Creation tunables are still only applied to NPC Sims. This restriction can not be ignored. Also, please consult your GPE partner before you tick this box. It can lead to some very bad bugs if multiple situations are trying to mess with a Sim's emotions/commodities.

TunableList.name: interaction_scoring
TunableList.description: Test for interactions run. Each test can have a separate score.

TunableTuple.description: Each affordance that satisfies the test will receive the same score.

TunableTuple.name: affordance_list
TunableTuple.description: Check to see if the Sim ran an affordance as a particular actor

TunableList.name: affordance_lists
TunableList.description: The Sim must have run either any affordance or have a proxied affordance in Affordances or these Affordance Lists, or an interaction matching one of the tags in this tunable's Tags field.

Tunable.description: A reference to a AffordanceList tuning snippet.

TunableList.name: affordances
TunableList.description: The Sim must have run either any affordance or have a proxied affordance in this list or Affordance Lists, or an interaction matching one of the tags in this tunable's Tags field.

Tunable.name: consider_all_cancelled_as_failure
Tunable.description: If True, test will consider the interaction outcome to be Failure if canceled for any reason. If this box is checked and consider_user_cancelled_as_failure is not checked, user cancel's will still be treated as failures.

Tunable.name: consider_user_cancelled_as_failure
Tunable.description: If True, test will consider the interaction outcome to be Failure if canceled by the user.

TunableVariant.name: interaction_outcome
TunableVariant.description: The interaction's outcome must match the outcome tuned here to pass this test.

TunableList.name: skill_tags
TunableList.description:
Skill tags to check against skill attached to the interaction, determined by if the interaction identifies it in skill loot data, or if it is an associated skill in the outcome.
If you are setting this and are not using affordances or lists for filtering, you probably want to ensure that you set interaction tags that are more or equally restrictive to either one of Interaction_Super or Interaction_Mixer. And do not use Interaction_All, unless you really want to trigger for both mixers and super interactions.

TunableList.name: tags
TunableList.description: The Sim must have run either an interaction matching one of these Tags or an affordance from the list of Affordances in this tunable.

TunableTuple.name: target_filters
TunableTuple.description: Restrictions on the target of this interaction.

TunableVariant.name: object_states
TunableVariant.description: Limit test success only to target objects that are in certain states

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: This option tests crafted item's tags against a list of possible tags.

Tunable.description: The object must have this definition.

TunableTuple.name: tag
TunableTuple.description: The object must have this tag.

TunableList.name: tag_set
TunableList.description: The tag of objects we want to test ownership of

TunableEnum.description: What tag to test for

TunableEnum.name: test_type
TunableEnum.description: How to test the tags in the tag set against the objects on the lot.

Tunable.description: What state to test for.

TunableEnum.name: test_type
TunableEnum.description: How to test the states in the state set against the objects in the inventory.

TunableVariant.name: object_tags
TunableVariant.description: Object tags for limiting test success to a subset of target objects.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Target object tags and how they are tested.

TunableList.name: tag_set
TunableList.description: A set of tags to test the target object for.

TunableEnum.description: A tag to test the target object for.

TunableEnum.name: test_type
TunableEnum.description: How to test the tags in the tag set against the target object.

TunableEnum.name: test_event
TunableEnum.description: The event that we want to trigger this instance of the tuned test on. InteractionStart: Triggers when the interaction starts. InteractionComplete: Triggers when the interaction ends. This is best used with a one shot interaction. It will not get called if an interaction is canceled. If you have a Sim parked in an interaction that you can only exit via cancel, you will not hit this. InteractionUpdate: Triggers on a 15 sim minute cadence from the start of the interaction. If the interaction ends before a cycle is up it does not trigger. Do not use this for short interactions as it has a possibility of never getting an update for an interaction.

TunableVariant.name: role_tags
TunableVariant.description: If enabled then we will require that the target of the interaction being scored is a sim and that sim meets the criteria of the black and whitelists.

TunableList.name: blacklist
TunableList.description: A set of tags that we will not apply the score if the target sim has one of them.

TunableEnum.description: A single role tag to check against.

TunableVariant.name: whitelist
TunableVariant.description: If enabled then we will make sure that the target sim has at least one of the tags in the role tags.

TunableList.name: enabled
TunableList.description: The set of role tags that we will check against the role tags of the sim.

TunableEnum.description: A single role tag to check against.

Tunable.name: score
Tunable.description: Score for passing the test.

Tunable.name: job_description
Tunable.description: Localized description of this job

TunableVariant.name: job_uniform
TunableVariant.description:
If enabled, when a Sim is assigned this situation job, that Sim will switch into their outfit based on the Outfit Category.
If the Outfit Category is SITUATION, then an outfit will be generated based on the passed in tags and the Sim will switch into that outfit.

TunableEnum.name: outfit_change_priority
TunableEnum.description: The outfit change priority. Higher priority outfit changes will override lower priority outfit changes.

TunableEnum.name: outfit_change_reason
TunableEnum.description:
An enum that represents a reason for outfit change for the outfit system.
An outfit change reason is really a series of tests that are run to determine which outfit category that we want to switch into.
In order to do this, add a new OutfitChangeReason entry in outfit-enums module.
Then go into ClothingChangeTunables->Clothing Reasons To Outfits and add a new entry to the map.
Set this entry to your new enum entry.
Then you can add new elements to the list of tests and outfit categories that you want it to change the sim into.

Tunable.name: playable_sims_change_outfits
Tunable.description: If checked, Playable Sims will change outfit when the job is set for the Sim. This should be checked on things like user facing events, but not Venue Background Event Jobs.

TunableVariant.name: situation_outfit_generators
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, the situation will use the outfit tags specified to generate an outfit for the sim's SITUATION outfit category. If generating an outfit make sure to set outfit change reason to something that will put the sim into the SITUATION outfit category or you will not have the results that you expect.

TunableList.name: enabled
TunableList.description:
Only one of these items is picked randomly to select the outfit tags within this list. E.g. If you want to host a costume party where the guests show up in either octopus costume or a shark costume, we would have two sets of tuning that can specify exclusive tags for the specific costumes. Thus we avoid accidentally generating a sharktopus costume.
If you want your guests to always show up in sharktopus costumes then tune only one set of tags that enlist all the outfit tags that are associated with either shark or octopus.
If some tags are only compatible with adults, and no outfit with that tag exists for children you should add an outfit test for that set of tags so that only adults can pick out of that item on the list.

TunableTuple.description: Set of outfit generator and tests that will be run on the sim to validate if the generator is valid for this outfit.

Tunable.name: generator
Tunable.description: A reference to a Outfit tuning snippet.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: Test set the sim will need to pass to be able to wear the outfit correspnding to the tuned tags.

Tunable.name: zone_custom_outfit
Tunable.description: If checked, we would request the current zone to give a special outfit for this job.

TunableList.name: location_based_filter_terms
TunableList.description: A set of filter terms, based on the current location, that augment the tuned filter. This allows for location-based variations.

TunableVariant.description: This may be tuned in place here using 'literal' or as a reference to a LocationBasedFilterTerms tuning snippet.

TunableTuple.name: literal
TunableTuple.description: A set of filter terms that vary based on the current location. Currently we only support variations based on current region.

TunableVariant.name: default_filter_terms
TunableVariant.description: Default filter terms to use if the current region is not specified.

TunableTuple.name: age
TunableTuple.description:
A term for filtering Sims based on their age. The score is modified based on the tuned ideal value for the age. If you are looking for age variation, please choose "Age Variant" instead.
Only new Sims may be conformed by creating them of a valid age. Existing Sims may not be conformed.

TunableEnum.name: ideal_value
TunableEnum.description: The ideal age of the sim we are filtering for.

Tunable.name: invert_score
Tunable.description:
Invert the score so that the filter term will score is the opposite of what the score would be.
For example, if sim is busy, normally would return 1, but if checked value would return 0 and would not be chosen by filter system.

TunableEnum.name: max_value
TunableEnum.description: The maximum age of the sim we are filtering for.

TunableEnum.name: min_value
TunableEnum.description: The minimum age of the sim we are filtering for.

Tunable.name: minimum_filter_score
Tunable.description: The minimum score that this filter term is allowed to have. The purpose of this is to allow 'relaxed filters' that don't prevent sims from being chosen.

TunableTuple.name: age_progress
TunableTuple.description:
A term for filtering Sims based on their age progress. The score is modified based on the tuned ideal value.
New and existing Sims can be conformed by advancing their age progress, within the tuned bounds.

Tunable.name: ideal_value
Tunable.description: Ideal value of age progress.

Tunable.name: max_value
Tunable.description: Maximum value of age progress.

Tunable.name: min_value
Tunable.description: Minimum value of age progress.

Tunable.name: minimum_filter_score
Tunable.description: The minimum score that this filter term is allowed to have. The purpose of this is to allow 'relaxed filters' that don't prevent sims from being chosen.

TunableTuple.name: age_progress_percentage
TunableTuple.description:
A term for filtering Sims based on their age progress as a percentage. The score is modified based on the tuned ideal value. Age progress values over 100% are capped at 100% for the purposes of evaluating a sim's age progress for this filter.
Sims may not be conformed to match this filter term.

Tunable.name: ideal_value
Tunable.description: Ideal value of age progress as a percentage.

Tunable.name: minimum_filter_score
Tunable.description: The minimum score that this filter term is allowed to have. The purpose of this is to allow 'relaxed filters' that don't prevent sims from being chosen.

TunableTuple.name: value_range
TunableTuple.description: The minimum and maximum age progress percentage.

Tunable.name: lower_bound
Tunable.description: The lower bound of the interval.

Tunable.name: upper_bound
Tunable.description: The upper bound of the interval.

TunableTuple.name: age_variant
TunableTuple.description:
A term for filtering Sims based on a list of allowed ages.
Only new Sims may be conformed by creating them of a valid age. Existing Sims may not be conformed.

TunableList.name: allowed_ages
TunableList.description: The allowed ages we're filtering for.

Tunable.name: minimum_filter_score
Tunable.description: The minimum score that this filter term is allowed to have. The purpose of this is to allow 'relaxed filters' that don't prevent sims from being chosen.

TunableTuple.name: can_age_up
TunableTuple.description:
A term for filtering Sims that may or may not age up at this time. Note: This probably does not do what you want it to do. It simply checks if the sim is not an elder and that aging is not disabled.
Sims may not be conformed to match this filter term.

Tunable.name: invert_score
Tunable.description:
Invert the score so that the filter term will score is the opposite of what the score would be.
For example, if sim is busy, normally would return 1, but if checked value would return 0 and would not be chosen by filter system.

Tunable.name: minimum_filter_score
Tunable.description: The minimum score that this filter term is allowed to have. The purpose of this is to allow 'relaxed filters' that don't prevent sims from being chosen.

TunableTuple.name: can_be_outside
TunableTuple.description:
A term for filtering Sims that may or may not be outside. Restriction is implemented only for vampires. It needs to be updated if we add other occults or systems that resctrict it.
Normal Sim will always pass this filter. Certain Sim, e.g Vampire, cannot be outside on daytime except daywalker vampire.
New and existing Sims may be conformed to match this filter term by granting or removing vampire trait and daywalker perk.

Tunable.name: at_anytime
Tunable.description: If enabled, the Sim needs to be able to go outside during day and night. Otherwise, it needs to be able to go outside at current time or during certain period of time.

Tunable.name: invert_score
Tunable.description:
Invert the score so that the filter term will score is the opposite of what the score would be.
For example, if sim is busy, normally would return 1, but if checked value would return 0 and would not be chosen by filter system.

Tunable.name: minimum_filter_score
Tunable.description: The minimum score that this filter term is allowed to have. The purpose of this is to allow 'relaxed filters' that don't prevent sims from being chosen.

TunableTuple.name: career
TunableTuple.description:
A term for filtering Sims in a specific career.
New and existing Sims can be conformed by granting them the career, provided any availability tests pass.

TunableVariant.name: career
TunableVariant.description: Define the career that this filter term applies to.

TunableTuple.name: from_category
TunableTuple.description: The filter term applies to the career, if any, of the specified category for the Sim.

TunableEnum.name: career_category
TunableEnum.description: The career category that this filter term applies to. Sims may be conformed if we want to remove the career, i.e. the term is inverted, but may not be conformed to join a career.

TunableTuple.name: from_explicit_type
TunableTuple.description: The filter term applies to a specific career.

Tunable.name: career_type
Tunable.description: The career that this term applies to. Sims that are conformed to the filter will enter the career at its entry level.

TunableVariant.name: career_level
TunableVariant.description: If enabled we add an additional requirement of the user level of the career to the requirements.

TunableTuple.name: career_level_reference
TunableTuple.description: Filters sims based on a list of CareerLevel references.

TunableList.name: career_level_references
TunableList.description: A list of CareerLevels. One will be randomly chosen when conforming sims.

Tunable.description: A reference to a CareerLevel to join the career at. The CareerLevel must belong to the career tuned above.

TunableTuple.name: career_user_level
TunableTuple.description: Filters sims based on a user career level.

Tunable.name: career_user_level
Tunable.description: A user level. If this level cooresponds to an advanced branch and we conform or generate a sim with this filter and the career has branches a branch will be chosen at random. If this behavior is not desired, use Career Level Reference instead.

TunableVariant.name: career_location
TunableVariant.description: Define how important career location is for this filter. Leave None if location is not important.

TunableTuple.name: on_active_lot
TunableTuple.description: Any Sim must be in the specified career and hired by the venue on the active lot in order to match the filter. Sims that are conformed by joining a career will be hired by the venue on the active lot.

TunableVariant.name: career_schedule
TunableVariant.description: Define how scheduling affects this filter. Leave None if schedule is not important.

TunableTuple.name: available_now
TunableTuple.description: Any Sim must be in the specified career and must be scheduled to work at the time of the filter request. If they are not, their career will not be conformed to match the filter.

Tunable.name: career_seniority
Tunable.description: If enabled, Sims that have been in the career for longer will score higher than Sims that have been in the career for less time.

Tunable.name: invert_score
Tunable.description:
Invert the score so that the filter term will score is the opposite of what the score would be.
For example, if sim is busy, normally would return 1, but if checked value would return 0 and would not be chosen by filter system.

Tunable.name: minimum_filter_score
Tunable.description: The minimum score that this filter term is allowed to have. The purpose of this is to allow 'relaxed filters' that don't prevent sims from being chosen.

TunableTuple.name: cas_tags
TunableTuple.description:
A term for filtering Sims based on their CAS tags.
Only new Sims may be conformed by creating them with valid CAS tags. Existing Sims may not be conformed.

TunableList.name: cas_tags
TunableList.description: Sims must have at least one of these tags on their parts for the filter to pass.

TunableVariant.name: creation_cas_tags
TunableVariant.description:
The tags to use when creating a new Sim with this filter term.
This should be same_as_cas_tags for almost all cases. Note that custom cas tags are supplied, the Sim must still have Cas Tags for sim creation to succeed.

Tunable.name: minimum_filter_score
Tunable.description: The minimum score that this filter term is allowed to have. The purpose of this is to allow 'relaxed filters' that don't prevent sims from being chosen.

TunableTuple.name: gender
TunableTuple.description:
A term for filtering Sims base on their gender.
Only new Sims may be conformed by creating them of a valid gender. Existing Sims may not be conformed.

TunableEnum.name: gender
TunableEnum.description: The required gender of the sim we are filtering for.

Tunable.name: minimum_filter_score
Tunable.description: The minimum score that this filter term is allowed to have. The purpose of this is to allow 'relaxed filters' that don't prevent sims from being chosen.

TunableTuple.name: gender_preference
TunableTuple.description: A filter term for filtering sims that fit the requesting sim info's gender preference.

Tunable.name: fallback_if_no_preference_is_set
Tunable.display: Fallback If No Preference Is Set
Tunable.description: If checked then if no gender preference is set then fallback.

Tunable.name: minimum_filter_score
Tunable.description: The minimum score that this filter term is allowed to have. The purpose of this is to allow 'relaxed filters' that don't prevent sims from being chosen.

TunableTuple.name: gender_relative
TunableTuple.description:
A term for filtering Sims base on their gender relative to target sims gender.
Only new Sims may be conformed by creating them of a valid gender. Existing Sims may not be conformed.

Tunable.name: minimum_filter_score
Tunable.description: The minimum score that this filter term is allowed to have. The purpose of this is to allow 'relaxed filters' that don't prevent sims from being chosen.

TunableVariant.name: score_spread_override
TunableVariant.description:
If enabled this interval modifies the spread over which the score should return.
A score is typically between 0 and 1. A score of 0 means the sim will never be selected, the higher a score is the more likely that sim is to be selected.
The score for statistic scoring is based on how close to the "ideal" value the value for the specified statistic for a sim is. It's a 1 if it's that exact score. It's *near* 0 (though not exactly, because the general idea behind this filter to make it a weight not elimination) as it gets farther from the ideal value and closer to the min or max value. (Note: it uses min_value -1 and max_value + 1 as the min/max values to avoid hitting 0. However the min/max values don't have to be accurate, so you can hit 0 by adjusting the tuned min/max values here as desired.)
So if you have it tuned as: min value: 0 max value: 5 ideal value: 5 The resulting score for each integer will be: 0 gives you: 0.17 1 gives you: 0.33 2 gives you: 0.5 3 gives you: 0.66 4 gives you: 0.83 5 gives you: 1
The minimum filter score tuning is simply a floor. Regardless of how low the calculated score is, if it's lower than the minimum filter score the result will simply be replaced with the minimum filter score.
So adding a minimum filter score of 0.5 simply results in: 0 gives you: 0.5 1 gives you: 0.5 2 gives you: 0.5 3 gives you: 0.66 4 gives you: 0.83 5 gives you: 1
This optional tunable modifies the spread over which the score is returned (and gets rid of the -1/+1 padding as you can specify the padding in the actual range.) So instead of returning from 0 to 1, where 0 is as far away from the ideal as possible, and 1 is at the ideal value, it'll return the lower value when the statistic is as far away from the ideal value as possible, and the closer you get to the ideal value, the closer the return value will be to the maximum value.
So adding a score spread override of 0.5 to 1.0, (instead of a minimum filter score) results in: 0 gives you: 0.5 1 gives you: 0.6 2 gives you: 0.7 3 gives you: 0.8 4 gives you: 0.9 5 gives you: 1
Note: Since, as stated, it's perfectly possible to lie about the min/max value, this result is also possible to achieve with clever tuning: min value of -4 max value of 5 ideal value of 5

Tunable.name: only_check_statistic_owned

TunableVariant.name: score_spread_override
TunableVariant.description:
If enabled this interval modifies the spread over which the score should return.
A score is typically between 0 and 1. A score of 0 means the sim will never be selected, the higher a score is the more likely that sim is to be selected.
The score for statistic scoring is based on how close to the "ideal" value the value for the specified statistic for a sim is. It's a 1 if it's that exact score. It's *near* 0 (though not exactly, because the general idea behind this filter to make it a weight not elimination) as it gets farther from the ideal value and closer to the min or max value. (Note: it uses min_value -1 and max_value + 1 as the min/max values to avoid hitting 0. However the min/max values don't have to be accurate, so you can hit 0 by adjusting the tuned min/max values here as desired.)
So if you have it tuned as: min value: 0 max value: 5 ideal value: 5 The resulting score for each integer will be: 0 gives you: 0.17 1 gives you: 0.33 2 gives you: 0.5 3 gives you: 0.66 4 gives you: 0.83 5 gives you: 1
The minimum filter score tuning is simply a floor. Regardless of how low the calculated score is, if it's lower than the minimum filter score the result will simply be replaced with the minimum filter score.
So adding a minimum filter score of 0.5 simply results in: 0 gives you: 0.5 1 gives you: 0.5 2 gives you: 0.5 3 gives you: 0.66 4 gives you: 0.83 5 gives you: 1
This optional tunable modifies the spread over which the score is returned (and gets rid of the -1/+1 padding as you can specify the padding in the actual range.) So instead of returning from 0 to 1, where 0 is as far away from the ideal as possible, and 1 is at the ideal value, it'll return the lower value when the statistic is as far away from the ideal value as possible, and the closer you get to the ideal value, the closer the return value will be to the maximum value.
So adding a score spread override of 0.5 to 1.0, (instead of a minimum filter score) results in: 0 gives you: 0.5 1 gives you: 0.6 2 gives you: 0.7 3 gives you: 0.8 4 gives you: 0.9 5 gives you: 1
Note: Since, as stated, it's perfectly possible to lie about the min/max value, this result is also possible to achieve with clever tuning: min value of -4 max value of 5 ideal value of 5

TunableTuple.name: can_be_outside
TunableTuple.description:
A term for filtering Sims that may or may not be outside. Restriction is implemented only for vampires. It needs to be updated if we add other occults or systems that resctrict it.
Normal Sim will always pass this filter. Certain Sim, e.g Vampire, cannot be outside on daytime except daywalker vampire.
New and existing Sims may be conformed to match this filter term by granting or removing vampire trait and daywalker perk.

Tunable.name: at_anytime
Tunable.description: If enabled, the Sim needs to be able to go outside during day and night. Otherwise, it needs to be able to go outside at current time or during certain period of time.

TunableVariant.name: score_spread_override
TunableVariant.description:
If enabled this interval modifies the spread over which the score should return.
A score is typically between 0 and 1. A score of 0 means the sim will never be selected, the higher a score is the more likely that sim is to be selected.
The score for statistic scoring is based on how close to the "ideal" value the value for the specified statistic for a sim is. It's a 1 if it's that exact score. It's *near* 0 (though not exactly, because the general idea behind this filter to make it a weight not elimination) as it gets farther from the ideal value and closer to the min or max value. (Note: it uses min_value -1 and max_value + 1 as the min/max values to avoid hitting 0. However the min/max values don't have to be accurate, so you can hit 0 by adjusting the tuned min/max values here as desired.)
So if you have it tuned as: min value: 0 max value: 5 ideal value: 5 The resulting score for each integer will be: 0 gives you: 0.17 1 gives you: 0.33 2 gives you: 0.5 3 gives you: 0.66 4 gives you: 0.83 5 gives you: 1
The minimum filter score tuning is simply a floor. Regardless of how low the calculated score is, if it's lower than the minimum filter score the result will simply be replaced with the minimum filter score.
So adding a minimum filter score of 0.5 simply results in: 0 gives you: 0.5 1 gives you: 0.5 2 gives you: 0.5 3 gives you: 0.66 4 gives you: 0.83 5 gives you: 1
This optional tunable modifies the spread over which the score is returned (and gets rid of the -1/+1 padding as you can specify the padding in the actual range.) So instead of returning from 0 to 1, where 0 is as far away from the ideal as possible, and 1 is at the ideal value, it'll return the lower value when the statistic is as far away from the ideal value as possible, and the closer you get to the ideal value, the closer the return value will be to the maximum value.
So adding a score spread override of 0.5 to 1.0, (instead of a minimum filter score) results in: 0 gives you: 0.5 1 gives you: 0.6 2 gives you: 0.7 3 gives you: 0.8 4 gives you: 0.9 5 gives you: 1
Note: Since, as stated, it's perfectly possible to lie about the min/max value, this result is also possible to achieve with clever tuning: min value of -4 max value of 5 ideal value of 5

TunableTuple.name: use_played_sims

TunableTuple.name: use_requesting_sim

Tunable.name: relationship_track
Tunable.description: The relationship track that we are filtering against.

Tunable.name: requesting_sim_override
Tunable.description: If checked then the filter term will always return 1 if the requesting sim info is the sim info we are looking at.

TunableTuple.name: requesting_sim
TunableTuple.description: A filter term for matching the requesting sim.

Tunable.name: invert_score
Tunable.description:
Invert the score so that the filter term will score is the opposite of what the score would be.
For example, if sim is busy, normally would return 1, but if checked value would return 0 and would not be chosen by filter system.

Tunable.name: minimum_filter_score
Tunable.description: The minimum score that this filter term is allowed to have. The purpose of this is to allow 'relaxed filters' that don't prevent sims from being chosen.

TunableTuple.name: sim_info_fixups

TunableTuple.name: skill

Tunable.name: ideal_value
Tunable.description: Ideal value of the skill that we are filtering against.

Tunable.name: invert_score

For example, if sim is busy, normally would return 1, but if checked value would return 0 and would not be chosen by filter system.

Tunable.name: max_value

Tunable.name: min_value

Tunable.name: only_check_statistic_owned
Tunable.description: Only require that the statistic is actually owned by the sim, ignoring the statistic's level.

TunableVariant.name: score_spread_override
TunableVariant.description:
If enabled this interval modifies the spread over which the score should return.
A score is typically between 0 and 1. A score of 0 means the sim will never be selected, the higher a score is the more likely that sim is to be selected.
The score for statistic scoring is based on how close to the "ideal" value the value for the specified statistic for a sim is. It's a 1 if it's that exact score. It's *near* 0 (though not exactly, because the general idea behind this filter to make it a weight not elimination) as it gets farther from the ideal value and closer to the min or max value. (Note: it uses min_value -1 and max_value + 1 as the min/max values to avoid hitting 0. However the min/max values don't have to be accurate, so you can hit 0 by adjusting the tuned min/max values here as desired.)
So if you have it tuned as: min value: 0 max value: 5 ideal value: 5 The resulting score for each integer will be: 0 gives you: 0.17 1 gives you: 0.33 2 gives you: 0.5 3 gives you: 0.66 4 gives you: 0.83 5 gives you: 1
The minimum filter score tuning is simply a floor. Regardless of how low the calculated score is, if it's lower than the minimum filter score the result will simply be replaced with the minimum filter score.
So adding a minimum filter score of 0.5 simply results in: 0 gives you: 0.5 1 gives you: 0.5 2 gives you: 0.5 3 gives you: 0.66 4 gives you: 0.83 5 gives you: 1
This optional tunable modifies the spread over which the score is returned (and gets rid of the -1/+1 padding as you can specify the padding in the actual range.) So instead of returning from 0 to 1, where 0 is as far away from the ideal as possible, and 1 is at the ideal value, it'll return the lower value when the statistic is as far away from the ideal value as possible, and the closer you get to the ideal value, the closer the return value will be to the maximum value.
So adding a score spread override of 0.5 to 1.0, (instead of a minimum filter score) results in: 0 gives you: 0.5 1 gives you: 0.6 2 gives you: 0.7 3 gives you: 0.8 4 gives you: 0.9 5 gives you: 1
Note: Since, as stated, it's perfectly possible to lie about the min/max value, this result is also possible to achieve with clever tuning: min value of -4 max value of 5 ideal value of 5

Tunable.description: A reference to a LocationBasedFilterTerms tuning snippet.

TunableEnum.name: no_show_action
TunableEnum.description:
The action to take if no sim shows up to fill this job.
Examples: If your usual maid doesn't show up, you want another one (REPLACE_THEM). If one of your party guests doesn't show up, you don't care (DO_NOTHING) If the President of the United States doesn't show up for the inauguration, you are hosed (END_SITUATION)

Tunable.name: participating_npcs_should_ignore_work
Tunable.description: If checked, any NPC Sims running this situation job will continue to do so instead of leaving for work when the time comes.

TunableList.name: recommended_objects
TunableList.description: A list of objects that are recommended to be on a lot to get the most out of this job

TunableTuple.description: Specify object tag(s) that should be on this lot. Allows you to group objects, i.e. weight bench, treadmill, and basketball goals are tagged as 'exercise objects.'

Tunable.name: number
Tunable.description: Number of the tuned object that have to be on the venue. Ex Barstools 4 means you have to have at least 4 barstools before it can be this venue.

TunableTuple.name: object
TunableTuple.description: Specify object tag(s) that must be on this venue. Allows you to group objects, i.e. weight bench, treadmill, and basketball goals are tagged as 'exercise objects.'

TunableList.name: tag_set
TunableList.description: The tags of objects we want to test ownership of

TunableEnum.description: What tag to test for

TunableEnum.name: test_type
TunableEnum.description: How to test the tags in the tag set against the objects on the lot.

Tunable.name: object_display_name
Tunable.description: Name that will be displayed for the object(s)

Tunable.name: requirement_text
Tunable.description: A string that will be displayed in the sim picker for this job in the situation window.

TunableList.name: rewards
TunableList.description: Rewards given to the sim in this job when situation reaches specific medals.

TunableTuple.name: benefit
TunableTuple.description: Reward and LootAction benefits for accomplishing the medal.

TunableList.name: loot
TunableList.description: List of loots to give when completing this job. Actor is the sim with the job. Target, if any, is determined by the loot_target field.

TunableVariant.name: loot_target
TunableVariant.description: If enabled then we will use the tuned situation job to pick a target sim (or sims) in the owning situation with that job to be the target of the loot operation. The loot_target_choice field will determine wheter we apply the loot to a single target (chosen at random) or all the sims in the given job.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The situation job that will be used to find a sim in the owning situation to be the target sim.

TunableEnum.name: loot_target_choice
TunableEnum.description: Behavior of how loot is distributed if there are multiple target sims.

Tunable.name: reward
Tunable.description: Reward to give when completing this job. Actor is the sim with the job. Target, if any, is determined by the loot_target field.

TunableEnum.name: medal
TunableEnum.description: Medal to achieve to get the corresponding benefits.

Tunable.name: should_revalidate_sim_on_load
Tunable.description: If true we will revalidate the sim infos in the situation on load. This means that if something happened to cause the sims to become invalidated then they will be counted as a no show on load. This is mostly to protect if someone messes with the sim in manage households to a point where they can no longer recover the situation. Set this to false if the sitaution should continue with them under all circumstances. Ex: During the birthday party that sim who ages up may become invalid to age after they end up aging up.

TunableTuple.name: sim_auto_invite
TunableTuple.description:
On situation start it will select a random number of sims in this interval. It will automatically add npcs to the situation so that it has at least that many sims in this job including those the player invites/hires. If the player invites/hires more than the auto invite number, no npcs will be automatically added.
Auto invite sims are considered to be invited, so they will be spawned for invite only situations too. For player initiated situations you probably want to set this 0. It is really meant for commercial venues.
You can use Churn tuning on this job if you want the number of sims to vary over time. Churn tuning will override this one.
For example, an ambient bar situation would have a high auto invite number for the customer job because we want many sims in the bar but the player doesn't invite or hire anybody for an ambient situation.
A date would have 0 for this for all jobs because the situation would never spawn anybody to fill jobs, the player would have to invite them all.

Tunable.name: lower_bound
Tunable.description: The lower bound of the interval.

Tunable.name: upper_bound
Tunable.description: The upper bound of the interval.

Tunable.name: sim_auto_invite_allow_instanced_sim
Tunable.display: Sim Auto Invite Allow Instanced Sim
Tunable.description:
If checked will allow instanced sims to be assigned this job to fulfill auto invite spots instead of forcing the spawning of new sims.
NOTE: YOU PROBABLY WANT TO LEAVE THIS AS UNCHECKED. PLEASE CONSULT A GPE IF YOU PLAN ON TUNING IT.

TunableEnum.name: sim_auto_invite_allow_priority
TunableEnum.description:
The Bouncer Request Priority that will be used to auto invite Sims into this situation.
Event Auto Fill: This should only be used for user facing situations.
Venue Required: Use this for Venue Employees that you want to make sure stay on the lot and don't get pulled into club gatherings or festivals.
Background High: Use this for important background events such as Club Gatherings or Festivals.
Background Medium: Use this for regular on lot background activities such as bar patrons.
Background Low: Use this for regular open street background activities such as walkbys.

Tunable.name: sim_auto_invite_use_common_blacklists_on_instanced_sims
Tunable.display: Sim Auto Invite Use Common Blacklists On Instanced Sims
Tunable.description: If checked and auto invite allows the usage of instanced Sims we will allow apply the common blacklists when selecting Sims to fill these roles.

TunableTuple.name: sim_count
TunableTuple.description:
The number of Sims the player is allowed to invite or hire for this job. The lower bound is the required number of sims, the upper bound is the maximum.
This only affects what the player can do in the Plan an Event UI. It has no affect while the situation is running.

Tunable.name: lower_bound
Tunable.description: The lower bound of the interval.

Tunable.name: upper_bound
Tunable.description: The upper bound of the interval.

TunableVariant.name: sim_shifts
TunableVariant.description:
!!!DEPRECATED!!! Please use zone director functionality to provide the same results.
If enabled, creates shifts of sims who replace the sims currently in the job.
When a situation is first started it will automatically invite a number of sims appropriate for the time of day. This supercedes sim_auto_invite.
This is primarily intended for commercial venue employees. This is NOT compatible with Sim Churn.

TunableList.name: shift_times_and_staffing
TunableList.description:
Each entry in the map has two columns. The first column is the hour of the day (0-24) that this shift starts. The second column is the number of sims in that shift. The entry with starting hour that is closest to, but before the current hour will be chosen.
Given this tuning: beginning_hour staffing 2 0 6 1 14 2 20 2
2am is a shift change that sends everybody home 6am is a shift change that brings in 1 employee 2pm is a shift change that sends the current employee home and brings in 2 new ones. 8pm is a shift change that sends the 2 employees home and brings in 2 new ones.
The entries will be automatically sorted by time at runtime.

TunableVariant.name: sim_spawn_action
TunableVariant.description: Define the methods to show the Sim after spawning on the lot.

TunableTuple.name: affordance
TunableTuple.description: The Sim will run an interaction that will make it visible.

Tunable.name: spawn_affordance
Tunable.description: The affordance that is pushed on the Sim as soon as they are spawned on the lot.

Tunable.name: fallback_vehicle_def
Tunable.description: The definition of the vehicle to spawn if the sim doesn't have a favorite vehicle.

TunableEnum.name: vehicle_obj_tag
TunableEnum.description: The tag to use to look up if the sim has a favorite vehicle to use for the spawn action.

TunableEnum.name: sim_spawner_leave_option
TunableEnum.description:
This, in conjunction with Sim Spawner Leave Saved Tags, controls which spawn point the Sim chosen for this job will leave to.
SPAWN_ANY_POINT_WITH_CONSTRAINT_TAGS: Randomly choose a spawn point with a tag tuned on the leave interaction's Spawn Point Constraint.
SPAWN_SAME_POINT: Use the same spawn point the the Sim spawned in from.
SPAWN_ANY_POINT_WITH_SAVED_TAGS: Randomly choose a spawn point with the saved tags.
SPAWN_DIFFERENT_POINT_WITH_SAVED_TAGS: Choose the spawn point with the saved tags that is furthest from the spawn point the Sim spawned in from.

TunableVariant.name: sim_spawner_leave_saved_tags
TunableVariant.description: This, in conjunction with Sim Spawner Leave Option, controls which spawn point the Sim chosen for this job will leave to. The default behavior is to use the same tags as Sim Spawner Tags.

TunableList.name: use_custom_spawner_tags
TunableList.description: The saved tags to store on the Sim to help the Sim decide which spawn point to leave to.

TunableList.name: sim_spawner_tags
TunableList.description: A list of tags that represent where to spawn Sims for this Job when they come onto the lot. NOTE: Tags will be searched in order of tuning. Tag [0] has priority over Tag [1] and so on.

Tunable.name: spawn_at_lot
Tunable.description: If checked we will spawn this sim at spawn points that are linked to this lot. Otherwise we will ignore that and spawn them at any lot's tags.

TunableList.name: tags
TunableList.description: Designer tagging for making the game more fun.

Tunable.name: tooltip_name
Tunable.description:
Localized name of this job that is displayed when the player hovers on the sim while the situation is in progress. If this field is absent, there will be no tooltip on the sim.
This helps distinguish the cases where we want to display "Bride or Groom" in the situation creation UI but only "Bride" or "Groom" on the sim's tooltip when the player is playing with the situation.

TunableTuple.name: tooltip_name_text_tokens
TunableTuple.description: Localization tokens to be passed into 'tooltip_name'. For example, you could use a participant or you could also pass in statistic and commodity values

TunableList.name: tokens
TunableList.description: A list of tokens that will be returned by this factory. Any string that uses this token will have token '0' be set to the first element, '1' to the second element, and so on. Do not let the list inheritance values confuse you; regardless of what the list element index is, the first element will always be 0, the second element 1, and so on.

TunableVariant.description: Define what the token at the specified index is.

TunableTuple.description: The token is a number repesenting the amount of the specified buck type the specified participant has.

TunableTuple.name: bullet_list
TunableTuple.description: The token is a string, which is a formatted bullet point list. Objects are grouped by definition. The text for each item must be specified.

Tunable.name: bullet_text
Tunable.description: The text for the bullet entry. The string is provided the following tokens, in this order: 0 An object representitive of the group 1 The number of objects in the group

TunableTuple.name: single
TunableTuple.description: The token is a single object name. If multiple participants are returned, an arbitrary one is used. That is, unless the mismatch key is specified. In that case, the string is used unless all of the participants' definitions match.

TunableVariant.name: mismatch_name
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, this is the object name to use when using a multi- object participant yielding definitions with different names.

Tunable.name: user_facing_sim_headline_display_override
Tunable.display: User Facing Sim Headline Display Override
Tunable.description:
If checked then the sim headline will be displayed on sims with this job even if that sim isn't part of a user facing situation.
Ex: Active Careers where we want to show the jobs of patients, co-workers, and the like but they aren't actually part of the user facing active career sitaution.
